user_question: Can you find a recipe for chocolate chip cookies, and generate an image of the final baked cookies?
final_answer: Here's a classic chocolate chip cookie recipe: Combine 1 cup of softened butter, 1 cup of white sugar, and 1 cup of packed brown sugar until smooth. Mix in 2 eggs, one at a time, followed by 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract. Dissolve 1 teaspoon of baking soda in 2 teaspoons of hot water, then blend into the batter along with 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Stir in 3 cups of flour and 2 cups of chocolate chips. Drop by large spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees F for about 10 minutes until edges are nicely browned. The image of the baked cookies has been generated. Chocolate chip cookies were invented by Ruth Wakefield in the 1930s at the Toll House Inn in Massachusetts.
